nextMarkerText: Welldone, Now select the yellow object and face to the camera to create your first Table(with rows and columns) for our Database
Welldone, Now select the yellow object and face to the camera to create your first Table(with rows and columns) for our Database

code:
CREATE TABLE `NovelTech`
 (`CourseID` INTEGER NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
 `CourseTitle` TEXT NOT NULL,
 `StudentID` TEXT NOT NULL,
 `CourseCode` TEXT NOT NULL,`TeamID` INTEGER,
 FOREIGN KEY (TeamID) REFERENCES TeamWork(TeamID),
 FOREIGN KEY (StudentID) REFERENCES Students(StudentID) );
nextMarkerText: Very well, Face the yellow object to the other side and display to the camera to create our second Table

code:
CREATE TABLE `Students` 
 (`StudentID` TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE,
 `StudentName` TEXT NOT NULL, 
 `CourseCode` TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE,
 PRIMARY KEY( StudentID )
 FOREIGN KEY (CourseID) REFERENCES NovelTech(CourseID) );
nextMarkerText: Yippie! Its time for creating your last table, please select the white object and face the camera

code:
CREATE TABLE `TeamWork` ( 
`TeamID` INTEGER NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
`TeamName` TEXT NOT NULL,
 `TeamNumber `INTEGER NOT NULL,
 `StudentID` TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE,
 FOREIGN KEY (StudentID) REFERENCES Students(StdentID) );
nextMarkerText: Welldone Champ! you have succesfully created three tables, To drop a table flip the white object to the other side

This is amazing! Do you know that there is a relationship between the three table you created? 
 An Entity-Relational Diagram(ERD) shows relationships between tables 
 using the field that uniquely identifies a table called the Primary key 
 and a field in that same table that uniquely identifies 
 another table called the Foreign Key of each of the table. To see this happen pick up the RED object and face it to the camera
